Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses feelings of anxiety related to job hunting and interviews, feeling frustrated by their performance, and concerns about financial stability.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has had several interviews that did not meet expectations, leading to increased anxiety. They also express worries about making ends meet and are considering side jobs to alleviate financial stress. Communication with their spouse regarding job hunting has improved, fostering better understanding.
Mental Health Observations: The patient reports feeling calmer after practicing mindfulness and expresses a sense of hope regarding their situation. They feel supported in their relationship, which contributes positively to their mental state.
Progress Evaluation: The patient shows progress in managing anxiety through mindfulness techniques and improved communication with their spouse.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to continue practicing mindfulness and explore freelance writing opportunities as a potential source of income.
Next Steps: The patient will work on incorporating mindfulness into their routine and will keep the therapist updated on their progress with freelance writing.
